What is new in this update? At first glance it may seem that nothing has changed, but we have been working hard the last months to improve the sync of the app. Now your projects will be synchronized more quickly on all your devices and they will take up less space in iCloud Drive. Let nothing stops your creativity!

Note: Keep in mind that you must update all your devices to the latest version of Story Planner so they can sync between them.

Happy outlining!

We have fixed a bug that, in certain circumstances, caused the projects don't sync correctly on devices where the app had just been installed.
We have fixed a bug that, in certain circumstances, caused the projects don't sync correctly on devices where the app had just been installed.

*Please note you will NEED to update ALL your devices to keep sync working*

New Features:
· We have completely redesigned the app to make it more comfortable, beautiful and current. We have also taken the latest Apple technology into account to offer you the best user experience possible. And this is just the beginning, because we’re going to keep working to bring you fantastic new features soon.
· We have added an organization system for projects that allows you to mark them as “in progress” or archive them as completed projects. In addition, you can now add tags to projects in order to organize them by categories.
· Text fields are now much more comfortable to use since they adapt to the text you write instead of vice versa.
· Photos are now displayed in a larger size and are better integrated into the character and location cards.
· You can customize predefined elements (character type, scene tension, etc.) and adapt them to your way of writing. You don’t have to stick to our model anymore, but can instead create your owns.
· Each character can have several functions, which will also be displayed in the character list.
· We have modified the plot colors and how they are selected so you can see all of the colors at a glance and change them more easily.
· We have improved the scene cards so that you can create characters, plots or locations from them more quickly, in order to later modify them from the corresponding tab.
· In scene cards, you can personalize act names and call them whatever you want. You can also add multiple plot lines to each scene, which will be reflected in the statistics.
· We have added new statistics that are also displayed via graphs so you can more efficiently analyze your story data at a glance.
· iPad has its own design so you can move through your projects more easily; we have improved the Slide Over and Split View and have incorporated the new iOS 13 (iPadOS) technology that allows you to open multiple windows of the app at the same time so that nothing interrupts your inspiration!

Compatibility:
· iOS 13-compatible.
· Updated to support iOS 13’s dark mode (system mode available).

Refinements and Changes:
- We have improved the automatic backups system. Now Story Planner only creates an automatic backup when the app goes to backgroud if you have made any change.
- Now if you force the app to close after have made any change, the app will create an automatic backup.
- The app won't create automatic backups if you don't have projects.
- The maximum number of backups will be for your iCloud account, not for your devices.
- Backups will create faster from now on.
- You will now see a message in the main screen of the app when synchronization data is downloading and syncing
- We have improved the files download for syncing.
- When the app starts will check if you have iCloud Drive on. If you don't have it, the app will notify you, in case you want to activate it.

Bug Fixes:
- Fixed a bug whereby the app sometimes froze when trying to sync with a slow Internet connection.
- Fixed a bug whereby nothing happened when you changed from "System" to "No" in dark mode options.
- Fixed a bug whereby if you changed the color of a plot when you were editing the title, the previous title was shown in the list of plots.

Refinements and Changes:
· We have added a feature highly demanded by many of you: Now you can duplicate characters, locations, plots and scenes.
· Besides, you can now send a copy of any element in your project (character, locations, plots and scenes) to another of your projects.
· Now Story Planner remember your last session and it will remain in the same projects tab you were in the last time you used the app —meaning, 'all projects', 'in progress' or 'completed' tab. This way you won't have to navigate to "in progress" each time you open the app.
· We have made more accessible the actions for all the items in the app. Now you can delete, duplicate, export, copy, etc. by swiping your finger over the item —also right-click on mouse on your Mac— or through the ellipsis ... symbol you will find at the up right inside the item.
· We have also included some minor performance improvements to make Story Planner more efficient.

Bug Fixes:
· Fixed a bug whereby there was a problem when trying to create a synogram with the first letter in a text field.
· Fixed a bug whereby an empty screen was displayed when you deleted a project and the list of projects was hidden. (iPad and Mac)
· Fixed a bug whereby an empty screen was displayed when you deleted an item from inside a card, with the card shown in full screen. (iPad and Mac)
· Fixed a bug whereby a third column was displayed when you open a project after deleted another project with three columns on screen. (iPad)
· Fixed a bug whereby an item was deselected when you scrolled and the item came out of the screen. (iPad and Mac)
· We have also included some minor bug fixes.

· Besides, now you will see the statistics in a fuller window on your Mac and iPad.

· Fixed a bug whereby the app crashed when you have multiple windows, and you delete or move all the scenes of an act in the list of scenes.
· Fixed a bug whereby the actions list doesn't show properly when the item in a list was too close to the bottom of the screen, on iPad.

· We have also improved the launch screen and now it is shown with a dark background when you have the dark mode activated.
· We have created some screens with tips that are displayed when you run the app for the first time on a device. · As always, we have made some minor performance improvements to make the app faster and easier to use. Happy outlining!

· Fixed a bug whereby, when you deleted a scene from inside a scene card, it disappeared from the list, but the card was still shown in the right column.

Over the last few months, we've been working hard to bring you a significant update with many new features. We hope you enjoy them:

· Progress Tracker. Now you will be able to set a goal and control your writing progress. You can choose between an overall target or a daily goal and set a deadline with the days of the week you use to write. We have also included some info about how to get the most out of the progress tracker.

· A Widget to Control Progress. You can choose any of your projects in Story Planner with a goal set and see your writing progress at a glance on your home screen. We are sure this will help you stay motivated and achieve your goals.

· We have fully adapted the app, ensuring that all text fields work correctly and leave enough space to write with an Apple Pencil on your iPad.

· Security Protection. Now you can configure the app to be locked with code or Touch/Face ID protection. 

· Drag and Drop for iPad and Mac. Now you just have to choose the picture you want and drag and drop it to the character or location profile. Moving items to a scene or another project works with drag and drop too.

· We have included keyboard shortcuts to help you boost your productivity, as well as full trackpad and mouse support (on the iPad).

· Organization by Tags. All the items in the app can be organized by tags now. For example, suppose that you want to arrange your characters by groups to see how they are related to each other. In that case, you can create new tags for Family, Friends, and Work and assign those tags to the different character profiles. You can also use this feature to assign species to your characters if you are a science fiction author.

· Search, Filter, and Sort. Organization by tags is useful, but you need a way to arrange and work with those tags, so we have added a search bar for all of the lists within the app and a filter to see the different items organized by tags. You will also be able to sort lists and search results by title, date, or manually.

· Color Themes. We offer different color themes now, for both light and dark modes. This way, you can choose the accent color you prefer and be more comfortable when you use the app.

· New Languages. We have translated the app into French and Portuguese.

· Other Improvements. We work to make this app even better and more comfortable to use with each update. We have thoroughly studied our interface and listened to the feedback from all of you in order to add small improvements that will make a big difference. We have increased the size and line spacing in the text fields to make them easier to read. We have also adjusted the crop and scale for images since many of you requested the option to zoom out to see and load the whole picture.

We keep adding new, useful features, adapting Story Planner to the latest technical advancements, and fixing occurring issues. You can follow our news or send us your feedback via Twitter: @StoryPlannerApp or www.storyplanner.app. - Thanks and happy outlining!
